text: Charles N. Haskell was an American Democratic Party politician. He was the governor of Oklahoma from 1907 to 1911. While he was governor, many progressive social reforms were carried out,The Oklahoma red book v.2 P.366 including ones aimed at improving working conditions.The History of Oklahoma By Arrell Morgan Gibson, 1984, P.131 Controversially, however, a bill aimed at abolishing child labor in the state was vetoed.Grass-Roots Socialism Radical Movements in the Southwest, 1895â€“1943 By James R. Green, 1978, P.73 ==References== Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Governors of Oklahoma Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing
title: Charles N. Haskell
